wikipedia_page.main: Michael Johnson (born 1964, Derby) is a British designer and brand consultant. In 1992 he founded the design studio johnson banks in London, UK. Johnson received the Design and Art Direction (D&AD) black pencil award for his fruit and veg stamp designs and the organisation's President's award in 2017. Johnson has published three books and the Victoria and Albert Museum (V&A) have nineteen of his designs in their permanent collection.

Johnson Banks, is a design consultancy in London founded in 1992 by Michael Johnson. The company specialises in brand consultancy and visual identity systems, focusing on work in the cultural, Government and charity sectors.

The company has won a number of awards including seven D&AD "yellow pencils",Debrett's People of Today entry on Michael Johnson one D&AD "black pencil",Page about the Black Pencil award winning project Fruit & veg stamps 13 Design Week Awards, four Art Directors Club of New York "cubes" and six distinctive merits.
